channel.title: fractal on epsilon dumblog
channel.description: Recent content in fractal on epsilon dumblog

item.title: Buddhabrot, domain coloring, fractal flames and nevroses
item.description: For the past year or so, I have been working on a buddhabrot using the lambda function, defined by $$ f_r(z) = r * z * (1 - z) $$ With \(r, z \in \mathbb C\). The goal initially was to simply compute an image (which I will refer to by the Buddhalog from now on) using the Buddhabrot technique, created by Melinda Green. A buddhabrot is a way to show the trajectories of points under iteration of a map: it’s an histogram of trajectories.
